HTTP Headers to receive as Attributes (Regex)

processGroups.comments:
This flow will track how many times a given flow file routes through it. If the number of times exceeds a specific maximum then it will route to the 'limit exceeded' port. Otherwise it will route to 'retry'.
The attributes it uses are 'retry.counter' and 'retry.maxcount'. If the 'retry.maxcount' is specified on a given flowfile then it will be honored. Otherwise a default of '3' is set as the maximum retry count.
As the flowfile goes through this flow it increments the 'retry.maxcount' attribute by 1. It then checks if this value exceeds 'retry.maxcount' and if so then it routes the flowfile to 'limit exceeded' otherwise it routes to 'retry'.
So you can configure the 'retry' relationship to loop back to the process you want and you can send the 'limit exceeded' to move on from that process to something else.

inputPorts.name: data
inputPorts.validationErrors: 'Port 'data'' is invalid because Port has no incoming connections

outputPorts.comments: Items sent to this port have not yet exceeded the maximum retry count.
